---

title:  "Logic Puzzle 39 - Angle Loop"
date: 2023-11-24 9:00:00 -0400
tags: [Logic Puzzle, Coding]
---

This is not a completely vanilla Angle Loop. It uses some Penpa+ hacks. 

Note: This puzzle is not solvable on mobile.

[Penpa+](https://swaroopg92.github.io/penpa-edit/?m=solve&&a=RcxBCkAhCIThu7T+F5lKdRbp/teol8QDFx/OMBGLKK2hEyl8MrnSiuVPBa+pifUnH1en/tTxTG2kzvZ/awM=){:target="_blank"}


<details style="margin-bottom: 20px">
<summary>Minor hint</summary>
You have limited vision in this puzzle.
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px">
<summary>Slightly bigger hint</summary>
Why are not all borders shown / how can you get more vision?
</details>

<details style="margin-bottom: 20px">
<summary>Giveaway</summary>
Resize your browser.
</details>
<hr />
<details style="margin-bottom: 20px">
<summary>The Coding Details</summary>
I was inspired by these <a href="https://twitter.com/wesbos/status/1727730566143803522" target="_blank">multi-browser demos</a> that have been popping up on Twitter/X. <a href="{{ site.baseurl }}/assets/angleloop/angleloop1.js" target="_blank">Here's the source code!</a> There isn't anything too special here, I have just taken advantage of the <code>window.screenX</code> and <code>window.screenY</code> attributes.
</details>
